content.raw:
* Cell count: correct
* Cell length: I agree it may be confusing, I don't have a good suggestion
* Normal count is confusing, yes, it's basically adding more layers. But it plays with the height offset in a weird way, the offset is counted from the middle of all "layers". I didn't want to touch the implementation of how the grid is working, but if we come up with a consensus on what parameters we should have and how they should behave, I'm up for redoing the way the grid is working now. (we can always port code from RViz, the grid is much more flexible there)
* Height offset: more specifically, the position of the grid in the world Z axis. When you have many layers, that is the center of all layers, which is far from any layers if there's an even number of them.
* Grid lines: Yes, it can be expanded and numbers can be input for each color value (RGBA)
